alert.note: Alert for Espanola Valley; Lower Rio Grande Valley; Santa Fe Metro Area (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Heat Advisory issued July 18 at 1:26PM MDT until July 19 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...High temperatures between 94 and 102 in the Espanola Valley and the Santa Fe Metro area. High temperatures of 102 to 106 in the lower Rio Grande Valley. * WHERE...Lower Rio Grande Valley, Espanola Valley, and Santa Fe Metro Area. * WHEN...For the first Heat Advisory, until 9 PM MDT this evening. For the second Heat Advisory, from Noon to 9 PM MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures may cause heat illnesses.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors.

area.areaDesc: Espanola Valley; Lower Rio Grande Valley; Santa Fe Metro Area
